channel.title: Setting up for Silabsoft?
channel.description: Well, i was messing around with PimpScape and was checking silabsoft on it, i added items to my bank, added into shops, and put them in item.cfg, and every id over 9999 turned to the item 9999? For instance, i put a runecrafting cape in a shop, and it appeared as Item id 9999. How do i fix this?

item.title: Setting up for Silabsoft?
item.dc:creator: @SmokeSome SmokeSome
item.description:
@SmokeSome wrote:

On another topic

MISINFORMATION IZ IREGAR ROROR.

Alright? Well, i got pimpscape, edited nothing. I got the “Pick” command, and i spawned a hitpoints cape, i equipt it, it will take off my cape, put my cape i had on in my inventory, along with item 9999, then when i remove the hitpoints cape it will turn into item 9999. Any ideas? :\

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up for Silabsoft?
item.dc:creator: @kniveslives kniveslives
item.description:
@kniveslives wrote:

SmokeSome:

Well, i was messing around with PimpScape and was checking silabsoft on it, i added items to my bank, added into shops, and put them in item.cfg, and every id over 9999 turned to the item 9999? For instance, i put a runecrafting cape in a shop, and it appeared as Item id 9999. How do i fix this?

Search your Item.Java for;

public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[10000];

Then replace all those booleans there with;

	public static boolean[] itemStackable = new boolean[20000];
	public static boolean[] itemIsNote = new boolean[20000];
	public static boolean[] itemTwoHanded = new boolean[20000];
	public static boolean[] itemTradeable = new boolean[20000];
	public static boolean[] itemSellable = new boolean[20000];

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up for Silabsoft?
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

Well, that’s an error I’ve never seen before. The best that I can tell you is to make sure this is all done correctly. I suggest you go through it over again.

Read full topic
